abstract: Theresa Villiers, British secretary of state for Northern Ireland, announces government-ordered assessment has concluded that Irish Republican Army remains, but is solely focused on politics; finding paves way for end of political crisis sparked by claims on part of Sinn Fein party that IRA is defunct.
lead_paragraph: An independent report into paramilitary activity in Northern Ireland found that the group’s command structures are still in place, but that the organization has a “wholly political focus.”

headline.main: I.R.A. Lives On but Poses No Serious Threat, Britain Finds
headline.print_headline: I.R.A. Lives On but Poses No Serious Threat, Britain Finds

snippet: An independent report into paramilitary activity in Northern Ireland found that the group’s command structures are still in place, but that the organization has a “wholly political focus.”
